STAFF = 'STAFF'¶
static has_permission(user_role, min_access_role)[source]¶

Checks that user_role has permission to access recourse with permission level min_access_role. :param user_role: The current users role. :type user_role: UserRole :param min_access_role: The minimum role that can access this recourse. :type min_access_role: UserRole

Returns:True if the user is above min_access_role, False otherwise.
Return type:bool

ovs.utils.timed_serializer module¶

Houses the timed serializer for secure token generation.

class ovs.utils.timed_serializer.Serializer[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to allow secure de/serialization of attributes using a salt.

static decode_attr(attr, key)[source]¶

Deserializes an attribute, using a key as a salt.

Parameters:
  • attr – The attribute to deserialize.
  • key – The salt to use with the TimedSerializer.
Returns:

The deserialized string.
static init_app(app)[source]¶

Initializes the static serializer with the app’s secret Note that it must be done in this manner because the app_context is not available until the application is created.

Parameters:app – the Flask app containing a SECRET_KEY
static serialize_attr(attr, key)[source]¶

Serializes an attribute, using a key as a salt.

Parameters:
  • attr – The attribute to serialize.
  • key – The salt to use with the TimedSerializer.
Returns:

The serialized string.
ts = None¶
